/* Input to this functions is a string contains multiple group of nested parentheses. Your goals is to separating those group into separate strings and return the list of those. Separate group was balancing (each open brace is properly close) and not nest within each other Ignore any space in the input string.
  >>> separateParenGroups('( ) (( )) (( )( ))')
  ['()', '(())', '(()())']
  */
const separateParenGroups = (paren_string) => {
  let stack = [];
  let stack_length = 0;
  const paren_chars = paren_string.split('(');
  for (let i = 0; i < paren_chars.length; i++) {
    stack_length = stack.push(paren_chars[i]);
  }
  const output = [];
  while (stack_length > 0) {
    const temp = stack.pop();
    if (temp === ')') {
      stack_length--;
      if (stack_length === 0) {
        output.push(temp);
      }
    } else if (temp === '(') {
      stack_length++;
      output.push(temp);
    }
  }
  return output;
};

/*

  Example:
  triangleArea(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
  triangleArea(1, 2, 10) == -1
  */
const triangleArea = (a, b, c) => {
  if (a + b > c) return Math.pow(a + b - c, 2) / 2
  if (b + c > a) return Math.pow(b + c - a, 2) / 2
  if (c + a > b) return Math.pow(c + a - b, 2) / 2
  return -1
}

export default triangleArea
